intro: Hieracium echioides subsp. macrocymum, commonly known as the large-crowned hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, hairy stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, with a distinctive, enlarged central disk surrounded by narrow, spreading rays. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, along roadsides, and in woodland edges.
